physical_examinations.relevant_findings: General: Alert & oriented, no apparent distress; HEENT: No scleral icterus, mucus membranes moist; Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs/gallops/rubs; Pulmonary: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes/rales/rhonchi; Abdomen: Soft, nondistended, mildly tender to palpation around incisions, no rebound or guarding, no palpable masses; Wound: Port incisions clean, dry, intact, no erythema/induration; Extremities: No edema, warm and well perfused
Chest radiograph: Mild bilateral pleural effusions, right upper lobe opacity suggesting early pneumonia, moderate cardiomegaly without evidence of pulmonary edema, mild retrocardiac atelectasis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Comparative to prior radiograph, lung volumes have further decreased.
